value:
Karel... Even if things can never
again be how they were... I must
keep going.

Only one can wield the sword of our
clan. Aside from my brother, all have
fallen... As will I, someday.$k$pAnd yet...here I am.

Your diligence is worthy of respect.
Take care not to overtax yourself,
however.

I have seen much on my journey, but
the sights here are rare indeed. Do
you have the time to be my guide?

Saw me training, did you? You might
think I have no need to, but the habit
is ingrained deep within me.

I am called Karla, and I have come to
deliver greetings. You have a friend in
$Nf.

My body feels so light. Is this what
it means to wield a sword?

Am I more my brother's match
now?
I have fallen short...

What strength... Thank you. I will
make use of this.

I am Karla. This place is very
strange... Who might you be?

My clan lives by the sword. Our lives
are spent improving our skills and
slaying our foes.$k$pEven our kin fall to our blades...$k$pAfter leaving the plains, I came to
realize that this is not the only form
strength takes.$k$pA sword is just a sword.$k$pOne man showed me how to truly
become stronger...$k$pMy brother has also realized that
the way of the sword is not merely
killing others.$k$pAnd after spending some time
observing you, I have seen a new
kind of strength.$k$pHow can I describe it? It is a strength
honed by choosing not to fight.$k$pI find it fascinating.$k$pUntil I can fully understand it... I will
stay by your side.
はっ！
ふっ
きゃああっ！
未熟…
My sword arts, brought to bear.
How can I refuse a fight?
I do not enjoy battle...
You will die.
I'll never reach him…
ふぅむ…
Only one can wield the sword. That is the law of our clan.
Hm? You took advantage of an opening. I imagine you will have no complaint if I do the same.
I set out traveling to find my brother. I felt...attached to him. I still can’t seem to let go...
My brother gravitates toward strong warriors...
We are not human... We are no different than this blade.
If I could, I would have stayed that way forever. Brother...
In the end, I know so little about the world. I wish for you to be my teacher.
Acknowledged.
*sigh*
Oh, I see!
